question.body: One cosmetic treatment for wrinkles is Botox. This neurotoxin helps temporarily remove wrinkles caused by repetitive motion, such as crow's feet. Which of the following explains why this treatment is only temporary and why it cannot fix other types of wrinkles?

multiple_choice.choice: Botox can decrease the tension of underlying muscles but not repair the damaged extracellular matrix proteins.
Botox can signal the fibroblast to secrete more extracellular matrix, replacing the damaged fibers.
Botox can signal to the muscles to stretch the epidermis back out.
Botox can reduce the damage by increasing production of collagen.

response.feedback: Correct. The toxin will cause paralysis of the facial muscles and reduce wrinkles, but it does not fix the damage, so it is only temporary.
Incorrect. Botox does not affect the fibroblast cells, it inhibits the neural impulses. Fixing the damaged extracellular proteins would fix the problem permanently.
Incorrect. Botox can induce paralysis of the muscles, which does not stretch the epidermis out.
Incorrect. Botox is a toxin that paralyzes the muscles. The fibroblasts are responsible for making more extracellular proteins.

part.hint: Botox only temporarily immobilizes underlying muscles.
